results.title: The Willmar 8 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: GTV Productions, Julie Thompson, Mary Beth Yarrow and Lee Grant
results.brief_description: An award winning documentary which tells the story of how unequal pay, denial of promotional opportunity and lack of respect drove 8 women to form a union and begin the first bank strike in Minnesota. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Will to work
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Michael Barden and RMR Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Supervisors in Action”.
In an amusing and unusual setting, Tom Fraser, a low morale producing supervisor is forced to re-live his supervisory mis-deeds. He is shown the far-reaching effects of his inconsiderable, insensitive and self-centred methods of supervising.

results.title: The Will to live
results.creator_credit: Val Colbert, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fragile at birth and not meant to live, Val Colbert’s mother went the extra step to keep her alive. This story is dedicated to Colbert’s mum’s tenacity and eternal strength.

results.title: The Will is not enough
results.creator_credit: Peter Jarvis, Howard Smith and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Middle East”.
The growth of Arab nationalism provided a base for President Nasser in his attempt to achieve Arab unity. Having dealt with the uniting of a vast number of peoples through Islam, the film considers the decline of the Ottoman Empire, the Imperial conquests of the European powers and the first Nationalist Movements that appeared within the Arab world. Newsreel footage from the 1920’s, 1930’s and 1950’s is used.

results.title: The Wildlife of Macquarie Island
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Norman Laird
results.brief_description: A picture of the wildlife on Macquarie Island stressing the harshness of the environment, where one creature preys mercilessly on another. Seaweeds and lichens; elephant seals; cormorants, sea vultures and skuas; black-browed albatross and many species of penguin are seen in the struggle for existence. The savagery of birds of prey is demonstrated as vultures stand by at the birth of a baby seal.

results.title: The Wilderness world of Sigurd F. Olson
results.creator_credit: Filmedia, Ray J. Christensen and Steve A Kahlenbeck
results.brief_description: An exploration of the creative response to nature of America’s foremost interpretive naturalist, Sigurd F. Olson. He talks about the challenges and joys of writing, and the wilderness areas of Canada and the northern United States, with film of the dramatic changing seasons of this area.

results.title: The Wildcat
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Bert Haanstra
results.brief_description: Describes the techniques involving in well drilling - the erection of the derrick; the drilling at appropriate speeds through different formations; the hauling out and running in of formations; the hauling out and running in of the drill string; and the sealing and cementing of the various strings of casing. Work goes on night and day, involving at times great strain and tension. Finally, the flow tubing is run in, and gun perforation at the level of the producing formation allows oil to flow into the tubing and up the well.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Film Unit, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Bert Haanstra

results.title: The Wild one [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Stanley Kramer and Laslo Benedek
results.brief_description: A group of youths in a motorcycle gang ride into a small Californian town and begin to terrorize the locals. Johnny, the leader of the gang, falls in love with a woman in town but any hope for their relationship is ruined by both the aggression of his fellow bikers, and the prejudices and closed-mindedness of the town’s people. “The Wild one” is one of many Hollywood movies to represent the emerging sub-cultures of alienated and dissatisfied Western youth who were the immediate predecessors to the generation in the sixties who were to create the upheaval of the “counter- culture”. Initially banned in Australia on its release, “The Wild one” is also notable for Marlon Brando’s electrifying performance as Johnny and its (then) innovative use of a rock and roll music score.
